conclusion: Analyze forces on the metal rod using equilibrium and magnetic force principles.
When current I1 passes, magnetic force balances weight: BI1L = mg.
With current I2, magnetic force is BI2L, acting in opposite direction.
Net force is F_B2 - mg, causing spring elongation.
Total upward force from springs equals net downward force: 2kΔx = F_B2 - mg.
Substitute mg = BI1L into equilibrium equation: 2kΔx = BL(I2 - I1).
